data.title: Electronic Music Club!
data.meta_description:

Mo Falk...
data.text:
Teravolt

cilan lives forever in my heart

Dec 23, 2020

#1

For anyone interested in the greatest genre of music on the planet. To start, I’ll give you all some links to my favorite artists:

Getsix: https://soundcloud.com/getsixofficial Mo Falk: https://soundcloud.com/mofalk Camellia: https://cametek.bandcamp.com/

MASTER BOOT RECORD: https://masterbootrecord.bandcamp.com/

ColBreakz: https://www.youtube.com/user/CoLBreaKz

Feel free to ask me any questions about the genre; I’d be more than happy to answer! Or just talk about the music and such.

pacman000

On a quest to be the best...

Teravolt

cilan lives forever in my heart

Dec 23, 2020

#3

May I join?

You don’t even have to ask! Just jump in and have fun!

pacman000

On a quest to be the best...

Dec 23, 2020

#4

Ok! Quick question: Can we post YouTube videos? I think there used to be a forum-wide rule against doing so, but I'm not sure if that's changed.

Anyways, the first thing I think of when I hear the term “electronic music” is the song Popcorn! Here’s a fan site for the song: https://popcorn-song.com/

Last edited: Dec 24, 2020

Teravolt

cilan lives forever in my heart

Dec 24, 2020

Trivia: the first song sung by a computer was “Daisy Bell (Bicycle Built for Two)“ in 1961.

#9

2020’s Song of the Year has been decided! Even though it was released in 2017, it’s helped me feel better.

Colbreakz & Wubbaduck-Friends

https://soundcloud.com/colbreakz%2Ffriends

pacman000

On a quest to be the best...

Jan 2, 2021

#10

Here is the original version of Popcorn, by Gershon Kingsley. Re-read the rules this week; YouTube is not specifically banned, but illegal copies are. This version was licensed to YouTube, because Google has that much power/influence.

This is slightly different from HotButter's more famous version.

pacman000

On a quest to be the best...

Jan 7, 2021

#11

The Elephant Never Forgets by Jean Jacques Perrey. Licensed to YouTube by Universal Music Group.

If I remember right this was used as the theme for an obscure kids' anime from the mid-70's, Polon the Star Child.

Captain Jigglypuff

*On Vacation. Go Away!*

Jan 18, 2021

#12

The only electronic music I listen to is from the 80s. Particularly synth new wave. Here is one hidden gem I’ve discovered recently.

Teravolt

cilan lives forever in my heart

Jan 19, 2021

#13

The only electronic music I listen to is from the 80s. Particularly synth new wave. Here is one hidden gem I’ve discovered recently.

Synthwave is an amazing subgenre. I highly recommend Waveshaper and anything from FiXT records. It’s like 80s music but a thousand times better (no offense to 80s music).

pacman000

On a quest to be the best...

Jan 21, 2021

Axel F

Jan 26, 2021

#15

Oh yeah, Camellia's stuff is great!! I'm pretty sure the first thing I heard was his old Vocaloid music way back in the day, before I even knew it was him who produced it, which is kinda neat. I admittedly haven't heard too much of his recent stuff but Break The Silence and Looking for Edge of Ground are both really good songs of his!

Captain Jigglypuff

*On Vacation. Go Away!*

Jan 26, 2021

#16

Does Ain’t Nobody by Chaka Khan and Rufus count as electronic music? All of the instruments used were synthesizers. Same for Yaz(oo)’s Situation.
